definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: I will give you thanks, for you answered me; you have become my salvation.
sentences.chinese: 我要称谢你，因为你已经应允我，又成了我的拯救。

sentences.english: God is faithful and you will see the answer to your prayers.
sentences.chinese: 你终必看见祷告得蒙应允。

sentences.english: I cannot assent to what you ask.
The Lord answered his prayer, and his wife Rebekah became pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华应允他的祈求，他的妻子利百加就怀了孕。

sentences.english: Then God remembered Rachel; he listened to her and opened her womb.
sentences.chinese: 神顾念拉结，应允了她，使她能生育。

sentences.english: Hours later the royal charter received the queen's assent.
sentences.chinese: 几个小时之后，皇家特许状获得了女王的应允。

sentences.english: It was not his will to destroy you.
sentences.chinese: 那次耶和华也应允我，不忍将你灭绝。

sentences.english: The incense for the ready to stay, the ready and final answer.
sentences.chinese: 金香求肃恭留下来，肃恭终应允。

sentences.english: The rest of the book of Nehemiah is the story of how God answered that prayer.
sentences.chinese: 尼希米记馀下的部分，便是记述神怎样应允他的祷告。

sentences.english: The zhen son borrow meaning is put forward to visit the emperor, the queens answer.
sentences.chinese: 贞儿借意提出探望皇上，皇后无奈应允。

sentences.english: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.
sentences.chinese: 塞耳不听穷人哀求的，他将来呼吁也不蒙应允。

sentences.english: And God responded to the entreaty for the land after that.
sentences.chinese: 此后神应允国民为那地所恳求的。

sentences.english: Even better, God has promised to reward your faithfulness in eternity.
sentences.chinese: 更美好的是，神应允要在永恒的国度里赏赐你的忠心。

sentences.english: But the LORD hearkened unto me at that time also.
sentences.chinese: 但那次耶和华又应允了我。

sentences.english: That's beautiful. That means your prayers have been answered.
sentences.chinese: 真美丽，这是说，真主应允你祷告了。

sentences.english: To the Lord I cry aloud, and he answers me from his holy hill.
sentences.chinese: 我用我的声音求告耶和华，他就从他的圣山上应允我。

definition: to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to give a nod of approval
to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
to follow the rules/to do as instructed/to play by the book/to comply with a request
approved by His (or Her) Majesty/permission graciously granted (from highly authoritative position)/to graciously permit/to condescend to allow
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
to promise/to agree to do sth
